pr_title: GG-30394 False start of cacheGrpStates initialization(in CheckpointEntry)

timeline.message: GG-30394 Other fix that won't mess with soft references.

timeline.bodyText:
to avoid mistakes in further refactoring, I suggest splitting this method into two with the following signature:

void addCpToEarliestCpMap(CheckpointEntry entry, Map<Integer, CacheState> cacheGrpStates)
void addCpToEarliestCpMap(CheckpointEntry entry, Map<Integer, CheckpointEntry.GroupState> cacheGrpStates)

And extract following code to extra method:
if (!earliestCp.containsKey(grpPartKey))
         earliestCp.put(grpPartKey, entry);

because if tomorrow somebody changes the condition there are no guarantees that they do it in both places.
timeline.author: akalash

timeline.bodyText: I believe it makes sense to add some comment why using cacheGrpStates from entry is a bad idea(to prevent further mistakes)
timeline.author: akalash
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -174,9 +175,10 @@ public WALPointer firstCheckpointPointer() {
      * is not finished yet.
      *
      * @param entry Entry to add.
+     * @param cacheGrpStates

replies.bodyText: I doubt that someone will reuse this method, and if they do, they can find current fix I guess.
replies.author: ibessonov

timeline.bodyText: As I understand you can skip the assignment of initEx here, because if you just throw an exception from here, initEx will be assignmented in the catch block.
timeline.author: akalash

timeline.bodyText: You can use variable 'states' here because entry.groupState(cctx) was called in this method a little earlier.
timeline.author: akalash
